This access includes the use of a large storage yard that can hold more than 450 containers at a time and has full use of industrial-capacity tools such as heavy-duty forklifts. These efforts complement offerings by WHSE Hub, the company’s storage subdivision, which provides a number of short-term and long-term storage options for specialized cargoes. FTL Hub and LTL Hub handle the company’s shipment operations. Operating nationwide, the company offers shipment delivery to the entire 48 contiguous states through its full truckload shipping. Last-mile shipping allows customers to handle local deliveries and event logistics in the South Florida area. These services include airport transfers, bonded and liquor-licensed deliveries, and access to specially trained and sanctioned drivers for the transport of hazardous materials.

(NYSE: OGS), a natural gas distribution company and the successor to the company founded in 1906 as Oklahoma Natural Gas Company, which became ONEOK, Inc. (NYSE: OKE) in 1980. Kansas Gas Service is committed to being an organization that strives for excellence. Their industry is evolving. There is greater competition and greater customer choice. These changes will yield exciting new opportunities to serve the customers who have trusted us as their reliable source of natural gas. They value that trust. It's been earned by their employees who have made it their business to satisfy customers year after year. Safety and environmental performance are their top priorities, and they work hard to deliver natural gas service with no adverse effect on the public, their customers, employees or the environment. So when the Office of Pipeline Safety issued a final rule requiring natural gas pipeline operators to develop integrity management programs for natural gas transmission pipelines in high-consequence areas, Kansas Gas Service created an integrity management program that meets or exceeds the requirements of the integrity management regulations.
